snippet: Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano of Japan and Shuji Nakamura of the University of California, Santa Barbara, were honored for their work with light-emitting diodes.
abstract: Physicists Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano of Japan and Shuji Nakamura of the University of California are awarded Nobel Prize in Physics for their work creating efficient light-emitting diodes; committee notes that LED lighting has created a whole new industry and is likely to be the lighting source for the 21st century.
lead_paragraph: Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano of Japan and Shuji Nakamura of the University of California, Santa Barbara, were honored for their work with light-emitting diodes.

headline.main: American and 2 Japanese Physicists Share Nobel for Work on LED Lights
headline.print_headline: American and 2 Japanese Physicists Share Nobel for Work on LED Lights
